com.yworks.yfiles.view

Interface ISelectionModel<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of items contained in the selection's domain.
    All Superinterfaces:
    IEnumerable<T>, Iterable<T>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IGraphSelection, IStripeSelection
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultSelectionModel, GraphSelection, StripeSelection

    public interface ISelectionModel<T>
extends IEnumerable<T>
    An interface that models the selection state of a set of items.

    This interface extends the Iterable interface for convenient enumeration of the selected items. Use the CollectionExtensions.getEnumerator(Iterable) to get all selected items.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface com.yworks.yfiles.utils.IEnumerable

    • Method Detail

      • addItemSelectionChangedListener

        void addItemSelectionChangedListener(IEventHandler<ItemSelectionChangedEventArgs<T>> itemSelectionChangedEvent)
        Adds the given listener for the ItemSelectionChanged event that occurs when an item changed its selection state from selected to unselected or vice versa.
        Parameters:
        itemSelectionChangedEvent - The listener to add.
        See Also:
        setSelected(java.lang.Object, boolean), removeItemSelectionChangedListener(IEventHandler)

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears the selection.

        This is a convenience method that will set the selection state of all elements to unselected.

        See Also:
        addItemSelectionChangedListener(IEventHandler)

      • isSelected

        boolean isSelected(T item)
        Determines whether an item is currently selected.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to check.
        Returns:
        Whether it is currently selected.

      • removeItemSelectionChangedListener

        void removeItemSelectionChangedListener(IEventHandler<ItemSelectionChangedEventArgs<T>> itemSelectionChangedEvent)
        Removes the given listener for the ItemSelectionChanged event that occurs when an item changed its selection state from selected to unselected or vice versa.
        Parameters:
        itemSelectionChangedEvent - The listener to remove.
        See Also:
        setSelected(java.lang.Object, boolean), addItemSelectionChangedListener(IEventHandler)

      • setSelected

        void setSelected(T item,
                 boolean selected)
        Sets the selection state of an item.

        If the state changes, this will trigger the ItemSelectionChanged event.

        Parameters:
        item - The item to set the selection state for.
        selected - Whether to select the object.

      • size

        int size()
        Returns the number of selected items.
        Returns:
        The Count.
